newsitem.title: FRANCE: French industry cuts 97 investment forecast.
newsitem.headline: French industry cuts 97 investment forecast.

text.p: French competitive-sector industry expects its investment, in real volume terms and historically adjusted for underestimation, to rise by three percent this year, an April survey of business leaders by national statistics office INSEE showed.

In the last survey in January, industrialists said they expected 1997 investment to increase four percent. They maintained their January forecast for the rise in investments in 1996 at one percent. That was down from the four percent they predicted in an October survey.
April survey Jan survey Oct survey
Investment in competitive industry represents only 30 percent of productive investment in France.
